Title: State government to help students get patent for unique projects: Uttar Pradesh deputy CM Dinesh Sharma
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Dinesh Sharma

LUCKNOW: Deputy chief minister Dinesh Sharma on Saturday announced that the state government would help in getting innovative and unique science projects patented in the name of students developing them.

Addressing students at the district level science project contest held at a school in Indira Nagar under the ‘Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research’ (Inspire) Award scheme, a flagship programme of central government’s department of science & technology, Sharma said the projects should work in real time, provide solution to problems faced by people and be better than existing technologies.

“The basic and secondary education department will seek legal opinion from experts to ensure that the innovative and unique models are patented,” said Sharma, who also holds the portfolio of secondary and higher education departments. He urged the teachers to encourage the students.

Students of classes 6 to 10 of all basic and secondary schools came up with various science projects to check stress, alarm to keep a tab on glucose in body, flower cleaning machine, smart cap for visually impaired and solar tracker, among others. A total of 32 models were selected by a panel of scientists for the nation-level contest.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Man chops off wife’s head, takes it to cops 5km away
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

FAIZABAD: In a horrifying incident in Barabanki , a man killed his wife, chopped her head and walked all the way along to the police station five kilometres away, holding it by the hair on Saturday afternoon to surrender. Locals and passersby on the route were terrified on witnessing the macabre sight.

The man identified as Akhilesh Rawat (30), a resident of Bahadurpur village in Jahangeerabad police station area of Barabanki district, was arrested. The family of Rawat's wife Ranjana have filed a complaint of dowry death.

As per reports, Rawat beheaded his wife and marched to Jahangeerabad police station which is about five kilometres away from his village, dangling it all the way along. Cops at the police station were shocked when he entered and announced that he has killed his wife.

Barabanki additional superintendent of police R S Gautam told TOI, "The accused killed his wife Ranjana (24) after both had a fight. He chopped off her head using a sharp-edged sickle. Police have recovered the murder weapon."

"Ranjana's father Govind has filed a complaint against Rawat, his father, brother and a relative alleging they killed his daughter for dowry," the ASP said.

"Three months ago, Ranjana had given birth to a baby girl who died after delivery after which she went to her father's place and had returned to Rawat's residence just four days before. Ranjana's father Govind has given a complaint accusing her in-laws and husband had been demanding dowry and they killed her because their demand was not met," he added.

"Akhilesh and his father have been arrested while police teams are trying to nab the two other accused also," Gautam added.

Title: Lucknow: Get hair transplant surgery at KGMU's dental faculty now
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Hair transplant surgery is now also available at dental faculty of King George's Medical University (KGMU).

Dentists at KGMU's oral maxillofacial department performed their first hair transplant on a 32-year-old man from Rae Bareli who was suffering from baldness for five years.

The condition is known as Androgenetic alopecia, common hair loss problem in both men and women, which occurs due to genetic reasons.

As many as 2,000 hair follicles were transplanted on the patient's head during an eight-hour-long procedure by a team of four dentists.

Dean, dental faculty, Prof Shadab Mohammed said the result would be visible in six months and till that time the patient would have to visit them for follow-ups.

Normally, hair transplant is done by a plastic surgeon and KGMU's plastic surgery department has been carrying out hair transplant for long.

Asked if dentists could perform such surgery, KGMU spokesperson Sudhir Singh said, "All the four dentists have also done a certificate course for this surgery. They are authorised to perform the surgery."

Title: Modi govt holds its nerve, Budgets for uncertain times
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Nirmala Sitharaman (file photo)

Amid the tumult over changes in the Citizenship Act, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is said to have firmly maintained that the support for him which resulted in BJP getting a stunning tally of 303 seats in May last year remains intact. The confidence, which was evident on Friday when he exhorted NDA MPs not to be defensive on CAA , runs through the Budget.

Amid ceaseless commentaries about the economy being in free fall and the warning that the declining GDP numbers amid social unrest could spark the kind of unrest which led to destabilisation of strong regimes in other locales, the government has held its nerve and is going to press along the path that has been attacked by pundits, here as well as abroad. There has been a ‘deviation’ from the fiscal deficit target, but the government has resisted the temptation to abandon the road of rectitude altogether in order to buy peace with sections which are supposed to be sullen.

The money so secured will be spent on infrastructure development which will be of a piece with the vision of a ‘powerful nation’ that Modi has successfully pushed since 2014; something which is also integral to the ‘strong leader’ model associated with him. Proposed changes in the tax regime might disappoint the better off among middle-class taxpayers who stood by him in 2014 and 2019, but perhaps reflects the calculation that a constituency which bought into the ‘nationalism’ and ‘ Hindutva ’ project will not be fickle, at least not so early. This is not an extravagant hope as the enduring popularity of other ‘nationalists’ attests to the power of affectatious polarisation.

The concessions will certainly strengthen Modi’s hold over the ‘aspiring’ ones who have broken into the middle-class category or those who are stuck there: a significant number who have been a big factor in BJP’s success. They, like the multitudes in rural areas, endorsed him on demonetisation and will be pleased with the belated move to strip NRIs of their tax immunity and glamour. Those engaged in farm and allied sectors will be pleased with the attention showered on them. True, the promises made in the last term have not borne fruit. Schemes — from the plan to create a network of warehouses to running of special trains and flights to transport perishable farm produce — are not going to result in tangible benefits immediately. But these can help underpin the promise to remedy the ‘raw deal’ meted out to rural areas and farmers over decades.

The rich will be happy with the attempt to smoothen the rough edges of the I-T department through the taxpayer charter, and the start-up entrepreneur will welcome the relief in taxation on ESOPs.

The outreach to MSMEs and increased duty on imports will help placate constituencies which were aggrieved over reforms like GST. The national combined online recruitment exam will certainly go down well with the ‘aspiring youth’.

The budget is full of big ideas, large infrastructure projects, embrace of technological breakthroughs and the challenges they pose — crucial ingredients which form part of the mystique of ‘the leader’. It factors in shrinking globalisation, reduced power of monetary policy, arrival of data as the new oil as well as disruptors like AI and machine learning.

But its strength lies in not giving offence, NRIs being the sole exception, to any significant section: not a small achievement in times of slowdown and social strife. It shows the PM remains focused on his script of development.

It brings out his belief that he enjoys sufficient support to go ahead and also, that he will soon have money—from access to sovereign wealth funds, sale of government stake, savings through direct benefit transfer as well as increase in revenue when recovery gets underway — to ensure delivery.

Title: Saadatganj murder case: Two held for killing senior citizen
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: The murder of a senior citizen found dead in his Saadatganj home locked from outside last week was cracked on Saturday with the arrest of two men, both having criminal record. The two accused had entered the house of the senior citizen living alone on January 21 and strangled him when he caught them stealing.

Police arrested Jameel (42), booked in 21 criminal cases, including theft and attempt to murder, and Dilshad (40), having five criminal cases. On January 20, Hari Shankar Gupta (80) told his neighbours that he was going to KGMU for check-up. When neighbours saw his house locked next day, they informed his brother Ganesh who lodged a missing complaint. On January 24, Ganesh broke the door and found his brother's body on the floor with caustic soda sprinkled all over, legs tied and a cloth wrapped around his neck.

SHO Saadatganj Mahesh Pal Singh said, "We scanned CCTV footage near the house and saw Jameel moving suspiciously at around 5.55am on January 21. We nabbed him from his rented home in Saadatganj on Saturday. He denied any involvement but when grilled confessed that he and Dilshad had entered Gupta's house through terrace. They found silver coins and Rs 5,000 in a trunk but Gupta woke up on hearing noise. They strangled him, locked the house from outside and fled," said Singh.

"Jameel had come out after serving jail term for theft eight months ago. He has been jailed 14 times while Dilshad has been put behind bars five times," the SHO said.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Higher allocations bring a ray of hope for elderly & divyangs
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Allocation of Rs 9,500 crore for senior citizens and persons with disability in the Union Budget is set to bring smiles to the faces of lakhs of beneficiaries of welfare schemes in the state.

According to officials of social welfare department, efforts are being made to widen the ambit of schemes to benefit more people and the number of beneficiaries availing pension under welfare schemes for senior citizens and persons with disability is likely to go up by around 10-12%.

They said hefty allocations have been made in the Budget in view of the proposed national social assistance scheme under which pension awarded to the elderly is likely to double in two slabs.

"In senior citizen category, pension may go up to Rs 1,000 per month from existing Rs 500 for those above 80 years of age and to Rs 500 per month from Rs 200 for people in the age group of 60-79 years," a senior officer said, adding that beneficiaries would increase in rural areas as it had higher population of elderly people.

"Though a token amount, pension is of great use to the elderly, especially women, who have limited means to fend for themselves," said Dr Abhishek Shukla, a city-based private geriatric physician.

Besides the elderly, about 41 lakh differently-abled people in UP may also get benefits.

Out of the total population, about 2% people suffer from disabilities.

Figures shared by the department of empowerment of persons with disabilities show that 31 lakh people with disabilities belong to rural UP while 10 lakh are from urban areas.

Genderwise, 23 lakh are male and 18 lakh are female.

"Higher allocations will certainly benefit disabled people but as of now we don't know the exact benefits they will receive," an official said.

Title: Rs 5,138 crore in purse, Chandigarh does not feel too rich
Content:
Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Against a demand for Rs 5,658 crore, the city received Rs 5,138.10 crore from the Union government on Saturday as its share in the new Budget. The 8.09% hike of Rs 384.98 crore is below expectation.The UT administration has received Rs 4,643.96 crore under the revenue head and Rs 494.14 crore under the capital head. The allocation in the last Budget was Rs 4,753.12 crore. The central government has increased the capital head by Rs 92.51 crore from last financial year’s Rs 401.63 crore. The capital-head funds are for development works, while the revenue-head money for salary payment and other recurring expenses.The finance ministry’s biggest grant of Rs 963.47 crore is for housing and urban development. The administration has planned to use the amount to construct flats of various schemes, strengthen road network, construct government buildings, restore and illuminate heritage buildings and underpasses in the city.The administration got Rs 962.75 crore for power and energy, an amount to be spent on upgradation of 33 KV to 66KV sub-station in different sectors, laying of underground cables, and installation of smart power meters. The UT would also focus on the promotion of model solar city programme.The administration would also carry out smart grid project. Besides, the UT Electricity Department will also carry out project of conversion of existing overhead lines to the underground system and replacement of infrastructure in Sector 8. Education features third on the list with a budget allocation of Rs 843.73 crore. The UT has planned to upgrade government schools, especially in villages.

Title: Budget out, chief secretary R K Tiwari wants schemes implemented
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

R K Tiwari

LUCKNOW: Shortly after Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the Budget, chief secretary R K Tiwari directed officials to implement all schemes at the earliest.

At a meeting with all additional chief secretaries, principal secretaries and secretaries, Tiwari instructed all departments to prepare plans for implementation of all new schemes and programmes as announced in the Budget, and establish contact with corresponding departments in the Centre.

The chief secretary said that ease of doing business must be implemented in the Secretariat administration, especially for swifter disposal of orders and to avoid delays in other administrative delays.

Title: Garbage processing plant: Jaypee company owner asks for more time
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

The garbage processing plant in Sector 25, Chandigarh

CHANDIGARH: Jaypee company owner Manoj Gaur on Saturday asked for some more time from the Municipal Corporation, Chandigarh, to think over the issue of handing over the city's garbage processing plant to the civic body. He said huge financial investment was involved in the project and his emotions were linked with the plant. Though sources revealed that Gaur had indicated at right and reasonable salvage value, if any discussion over the handing over of the plant is discussed later, but since he had asked for time to think, the civic body would wait for his decision during the next meeting.

Gaur, who, along with his administrative and technical team, held a meeting with the MC, chaired by mayor Rajbala Malik and municipal commissioner K K Yadav, along with officers concerned, took over two hours to deliberate on this issue. During the meeting, besides the financial component, both administrative and legal aspects were also discussed in detail.

"Since significant investment is involved in setting up of the plant, it will surely have the issue of salvage value and thus financial component is quite crucial. If Jaypee makes up mind to hand over the plant, then an independent evaluator can be engaged to come up the with the financial component of salvage value and discussion can be held on the same. Our key motive is to solve the problem at any cost," sources in the MC revealed.

While discussing the issue, the MC tried to convince Gaur and his team that the ongoing scenario with regard to the plant is not in favour of anybody and was affecting the city a lot as residents were suffering from foul smell emanating from the plant on a regular basis.

"The current scenario of the plant is neither in your (Jaypee company) favour, nor in MC's favour and the litigation is not good for any party. Therefore, the matter needs to be solved amicably for the overall betterment of the city," MC told Gaur.

During the discussion, Jaypee raised the issue of tipping fee again and asked the MC to think over that. But like earlier, the civic body authority once again outrightly refused to give tipping fee to Jaypee.

Gaur's meeting with the MC had come following a meeting with company's director Rajvijay last week. As the MC had refused to hold discussion with Ranvijay and had asked him to bring owner of the company Manoj Gaur for a meeting to discuss the issue, Gaur came on Saturday and discussed the same.

Title: Rs 100 crore for Chabahar port, but external affairs ministry budget slashed
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

The Union Budget saw the government more than doubling the allocation for the Chabahar port project in Iran whose fate was the subject of much speculation recently because of increased US-Iran tensions. While the allocation in the last Budget was Rs 45 crore, it has been increased to Rs 100 crore this year.

While India has practically stopped importing crude from Iran under pressure from the US, it has remained committed to development of Chabahar port which allows it access to Afghanistan and central Asia bypassing Pakistan.

India’s total allocation for the immediate neighbourhood (Afghanistan, Maldives, Bangladesh , Nepal, Bhutan , Myanmar and Sri Lanka) in 2020-21 is Rs 5,084.65 crore. The figure for last year was Rs 5,652 crore. Even the total budget for the MEA has gone down by more than Rs 500 crore — from Rs 17,884 crore last year to Rs 17, 346 crore.

The biggest loss in terms of aid to countries has been for Nepal whose allocation has gone down from Rs 1,200 crore to Rs 800 crore. The biggest gainer, like last year, has been Bhutan. For overall international cooperation, the budget has been increased from Rs 448 crore to Rs 509 crore.

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Shehnaz Gill gets mad at Sidharth Shukla for accusing her of flipping, he calls her ‘unstable’
Content: The latest episode of Bigg Boss 13 saw a bitter fight between lovers Shehnaz Gill and Sidharth Shukla During a task by Bigg Boss, Shehnaz got upset when Sidharth talked about her habit of flipping. After the task ended, Shehnaz got up and told everyone not to call her a ‘flip character’ or portray her negatively. Sidharth began to shout at her and told her she wasn’t mentally stable or even loyal.Shehnaz retorted by telling him that no one is clear about their relationships in the house unlike her. She added that everyone flips at one point or the other.During their fight, Shehnaz told Sidharth she will take a stand for those who are right, and then called him a loser for using her name to win the task. She said she considers him weak for doing so.Sidharth called her ‘gadhi’ and asked her to use her ‘dimaag’ in the game. He told her he doesn’t trust her at all. And he would like to keep things to himself. Shehnaz told him that she would want the person who is close to her to at least speak his mind. But Sidharth refused to do so.Later, Vikas talked to Shehnaz and explained Sidharth’s stance. She asked him to speak with Sidharth once and tell him how much his actions hurt her. He agreed to it. At night, Shehnaz went to Sidharth but he told her he wasn’t okay with what had transpired between them.

Title: Watch: Disha Patani nails the leg press workout and shells out major fitspiration goals
Content: The fitabulous actress Disha Patani who is currently busy with promotions of her upcoming thriller ' Malang ' is quite strict with her fitness regime. While usually, people prefer to go to the gym once in a day this actress likes working out twice in a day. She often shares amazing fitness pictures and videos on Instagram.Recently, the actress took to her Instagram handle to share a video slaying the leg press workout. The actress had shared a birthday post for her trainer. "360 pounds (163 kg), 4 counts, toes out “leg press”🧏🏼‍♀️🦵❤️ happy bday raj sir❤️ (i died) 🧟‍♀️", she captioned the video. We are sure Tiger Shroff will be quite impressed after watching this!Meanwhile, talking about her fitness and food habits she said in a statement, "There is a difference between starving and eating healthy. I always choose healthier options. Ninety per cent of how you look depends on what you eat. If I'm not eating right, no matter how much I train, I won't improve. I am a lover of sweet things and I eat as my heart permits once a week."Disha also added that she tries to work out daily to keep the perfect balance of the body.On the work front, Disha was last seen in Salman Khan starrer 'Bharat'. She will also star in Salman's 'Radhe: Your Most Wanted Bhai'. Directed by Prabhudheva , the film will also feature Randeep Hooda in pivotal roles. It is slated to release during this year's Eid.

Title: Six from Mohali tested 'negative' for coronavirus
Content:
Passengers, especially having travel history of China, are under close watch of the health authorities

MOHALI: The Mohali health department has scanned six residents for coronavirus on Saturday. All these residents have returned from China, Thailand, Canada, Malaysia and Europe."The teams visited their residences and tested them," said civil surgeon Dr Manjit Singh.He said two residents of Zirakpur returned from China. A girl who was studying medical and her brother who had gone to get her back were scanned for the suspected virus, but they tested negative.He said more such residents who had returned from Canada, Thailand, Malaysia and Europe living in Kharar, Mohali city and Mullanpur, were tested for the virus and the results were negative.Dr Manjit Singh said, "We have issued instructions to all the teams in PHCs and CHCs to keep a tab on anyone returning from abroad and conduct the test. Also, meetings were held with four leading private hospitals to institute isolation rooms which can be used if any person tests positive. Max, Fortis, IVY and Sohana eye hospitals have been put on alert."He said a medical team of the district hospital screened a total of 186 passengers of Air India Express flight from Sharjah at the International Airport in Mohali. However, no passenger was found having symptoms of the disease.Civil surgeon Dr Manjit Singh, who led the team comprising of district epidemiologist and medicine specialists, said all the passengers were screened for symptoms of the disease and no passenger was found to be having symptoms of severe fever, cough, shortness of breath, diarrhoea, congestion in nose and throat, all passengers were asymptomatic. Besides, no passenger was found, who had traveled to China in the last few days, to have contact with any person returning from China.He said isolation wards were already in place at the airport and all the government health institutions across the district.Passengers, especially having travel history of China, are under close watch of the health authorities.The medical team include district epidemologist Dr Harmandeep Kaur, medicine specialist Dr Navdeep Singh, Dr Puneet, Dr Amarjeet Kaur, chief immigration officer Sanjeev Kumar and other health and airport officials.

Title: Noida: Worker dies as ammonia leaks at Haldiram’s factory in Sector 65
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

An NDRF team sprays water

NOIDA: A 42-year-old worker died and six of his colleagues lost consciousness after a pipe supplying ammonia exploded and the gas leaked at a Haldiram manufacturing unit in Sector 65 on Saturday.

There were more than 300 people at the factory when the pipe supplying ammonia to the freezer of the processing unit exploded around noon. People who were around the pipe at that time complained of burns, nausea, and lost consciousness after some time.

PC Mishra, administrator at the factory, said the internal fire systems were immediately activated and the injured persons were rushed to the nearby Global and Tripathi hospitals. “The injured persons were given immediate treatment and their condition was stated to be stable. But, Sanjeev Kumar, who worked as an operator at the Haldiram’s unit, was declared dead on arrival at Tripathi hospital,” he said.

Kumar, originally from Meerut, had joined Haldiram’s only a month ago. “Along with him was 18-year-old Rupesh. He is being treated in ICU,” Mishra said. After the pipe exploded and gas started showing its effect, the workers at the plant were told to evacuate the building immediately. Water was sprinkled so that the gas settled down to some extent. NDRF teams, fire department and police arrived within half an hour.

RS Kushwaha, deputy commandant of the NDRF unit in Ghaziabad, said they received a call about the gas leak around 12.30pm. “By the time we reached, people there had turned off the gas regulators. We neutralised the contaminants and washed the floors using ‘fast act’ chemicals. It took almost an hour to completely disperse the gas,” he said.

The Haldiram’s plant is divided into four blocks, of which one is under construction. The three blocks are currently used for cooking, processing and packaging.

“We use ammonia as a cooling agent in the processing unit, where it is kept in three condensers. There are three pipes to channel the gas to the freezer. One of these pipes exploded,” the plant administrator told TOI.

The leaking gas had a cascading effect on workers at an adjoining building too. Rehmat Ali , who works with Fine Lines located behind the Haldiram’s plant, said he heard a loud explosion and a pungent smell followed. “There was a burning sensation in our eyes and skin. It started feeling nauseating ,” Ali said.

DCP Harish Chander said the effect of the leaking gas could have been worse had the NDRF team not arrived in time from Ghaziabad. “Police had also reached the spot in time and a thorough inspection of the spot was done. The NDRF team also examined the situation and brought it under control within two hours,” he said.

Sanjeev’s body would be handed over to his family after an autopsy, Chander said. The officer added a case would be lodged if a complaint was filed at the local police station.

Title: Delhi University student, Class 12 boy among 3 who shot trader, arrested
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Police have also recovered a country-made pistol and the motorcycle used in the crime from the possession of t... Read More

GHAZIABAD: Three youths, including a Class 12 and a Delhi University student, have been arrested for allegedly killing a medical store owner in Loni Border area.

Shavez Mirza (21) was allegedly shot dead by three bike-borne miscreants on January 28 in Loni’s Arya Nagar colony. At the time of the crime, Shavez was standing outside his medical store.

According to the police, the assailants have been identified as Adil Khan (20), BCom student from Delhi University, Sumit Kumar (20), pursuing ITI course from Ghaziabad and Abhay alias Kallu, Class 12 (Arts) student from a private school in Ghaziabad.

Meanwhile, two other youths who were involved in the crime are absconding and were identified as Robin and Badal. All belong to Loni.

Neeraj Kumar Jadaun, SP (Rural) told TOI that Adil works in a medical shop as a part time employee. On January 28, Sadab, a friend of Shavez had gone to Adil to ask for some cash. Adil said no customer had arrived till that time therefore there was not enough cash available in the shop. On that, they both had an argument which lead to a fight.

“Shavez interfered and separated them. Later, Adil told Badal about the argument following which Badal along with his friends came to beat Sadab but Shavez came in between to help his friend. Badal called over some more friends. Meanwhile, Adil and Sumit passed the information about Shavez’s location. Abhay was riding the bike and Robin and Badal were seated behind. They called Shavez outside and shot a bullet in his head and fled,” the SP added.

Police have also recovered a country-made pistol and the motorcycle used in the crime from the possession of the arrested men. All three have been sent to jail after producing them into a court.

Title: Buses collide on Yamuna expressway, 15 injured
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Police said the drivers were exchanging seats when the accident occurred.

GREATER NOIDA: Fifteen passengers were injured when two sleeper buses collided with each other on the Yamuna Expressway on Saturday morning.

The victims were rushed to hospitals in Greater Noida from where two patients were referred to Delhi’s Safdarjung hospital.

The accident occurred at 4.30am when a private bus coming from UP’s Siddharthnagar stopped near zero point. “The driver was sleepy and stopped to ask his colleague to take over the wheels,” said DCP (Zone 3) Rajesh Kumar Singh.

The two drivers were exchanging seats when suddenly another private bus coming from Auraiya rammed the stationary bus, Singh said, adding: “There were around 150 passengers in the buses.”

Sub-inspector Naseem Ahmed said, “The injured persons were rescued and rushed to Kailash Hospital in Kasna and Government Institute of Medical Science (GIMS) in police vans and ambulances. Most of them were discharged after first aid.”

The injured persons have been identified as Virendra (50), his wife Rajkumari (45), Shalini (50), her daughter Jyoti (20), Dhariwal (45), his wife Suman (41), Yatendra (40), Ashok Kumat Singh (35), Rajeshwar Singh (40), Rajesh Singh (45), his wife Vimdlesh (40), Bhupendra (30), Ram Vriksha (35), Surendra Kumar (20) and Ankita (25).

Kailash hospital spokesperson BK Sharma said most of the patients were admitted with minor injuries.

GIMS medical representative said Rajesh Singh and Bhupendra were referred to Safdarjung hospital.

The drivers and conductors of the buses are said to be absconding. “We are waiting for a victim to lodge a complaint otherwise a suo moto cognizance will be taken and a case of rash driving will be filed,” said Singh.

Title: Jaundice cases jump in Kurukshetra, touch 95
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Teams of health officials are visiting families to spread awareness on precautions to be taken against jaundic... Read More

KURUKSHETRA: The cases of jaundice are growing exponentially in urban estate of Thanesar in Kurukshetra district with the total reaching 95 by Saturday. Haryana health department officials said all the cases were reported from Sector 3 of Thanesar city and they had started a temporary OPD at the local gurdwara.

The health officials are also collecting water and blood samples from the area every day. As a precaution, along with Sector 3, they have started conducting door-to-door survey in Sector 4, 5, 30, and Rampur Dera areas which fall under the jurisdiction of the Haryana Shahri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP). So far, three deaths have been reported from the water-borne disease in Sector 3.

Kurukshetra district survey officer Dr S K Sahota said, “On Saturday, three new cases were confirmed, taking the total to 95 in about a week. The health department is checking for the water supply pipe leakages every day and informing HSVP to carry out repairs.”

Kurukshetra civil surgeon Dr Sukhbir said, “The tablets of Halazone and oral rehydration solution (ORS) are being distributed among the residents. A mass awareness campaign is also being conducted. As per the orders of the Kurukshetra deputy commissioner, every day inspection and follow-up of entire Sector 3 area is being conducted.”

The health department has appealed to the residents to consume boiled water after cooling it and keep special care of hygiene before consuming food.

Meanwhile, Kurukshetra MP Nayab Singh Saini, accompanied by Kurukshetra deputy commissioner Dhirendra Khadgata, also visited the families of the deceased. He said, “Kurukshetra DC has been instructed to prepare a list of the officials who are responsible for the negligence leading to the loss of lives.” On condition of water supply pipes, the MP said, “The CM has sought an estimate for permanently fixing the water supply issue. The problem will be fixed soon.”

Title: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala booked for promoting violence
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Sidhu Moose Wala

BATHINDA: Mansa police have registered a case against Punjabi singer Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu, popularly known as Sidhu Moose Wala , and Mankirat Aulakh for a video clip shown in social media which propagates violence.

The case was registerted at Mansa sadar police station on Saturday under sections 294 (sings, recites or utters any obscene song), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace) and 149 (unlawful assembly) of the IPC.

On January 12, Chandigarh-based advocate Hari Chand Arora had sent a notice to the Punjab Police DGP and the senior superintendent of police, Mansa, to take action against Moosewala and his companion for a video on YouTube, which propagates violence. Citing a 2019 judgment of the Punjab and Haryana high court, wherein the DGP was directed to ensure that no songs glorifying liquor, wine, drugs and violence are played and SSPs to be personally responsible to ensure due compliance of directions, Arora had asked the officers to act in the matter in 10 days, failing which he would move appropriate proceedings under the Contempt of Courts Act before the high court for purported non-compliance of the directions. He had sent the copy of high court order of July 22, 2019 and CD of the video being shown on YouTube.

Although the song — Pakhia pakhia pakhia, gun wich panj goliya ni tere panj veera lei rakhiya... (Pakhia pakhia pakhia, there are five bullets in the gun, which I have kept for your five brothers...) — was released in 2013, it was uploaded on YouTube on November 27, 2019.

“I had sent the notice to the DGP and the Mansa SSP along with a copy of judgment and copy of CD of the video uploaded on YouTube after recording... Now, a case has been registered on his complaint,” said Arora.

Mansa Sadar police station SHO Balwinder Singh said, “A case has been registered against Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu and Mankirat Singh under relevant sections and the matter is being investigated.”

Moosewala was not available for comments.

Title: Gujarat: Only 22 marine police stations for 1,600km coast
Content:
With just 22 police stations and 30 interceptor boats, each marine police station is tasked with covering an a... Read More

VADODARA: Gujarat may boast of the longest coastline in the country. But when it comes to security infrastructure meant for protecting the coast of about 1,600 kilometres, the state lags behind other coastal states.Time and again, the coastlines of the state have been put on high alert due to the state’s proximity to Pakistan. But with the limitations of infrastructure, there is little that the marine police can do. The Data on Police Organizations, 2019, released by the Union ministry of home affairs on Wednesday shows that many other states which are far away from Pakistan and have shorter coastline have a greater number of marine police stations .With just 22 police stations and 30 interceptor boats, each marine police station is tasked with covering an average coastline area of over 72 kilometres. The Gujarat police has planned to add 13 more marine police stations under Phase-III, but it is highly unlikely to come up any time soon. According to senior police officials, the Phase-II will end only this year. Every police station in Karnataka is responsible for average coastline of 5 kilometres, in Maharashtra this area is 16 kilometres and in Tamil Nadu and Odisha it is 25 and 26 kilometres respectively.“Our structure is different from other states’ structures. We have 22 police stations, but there are 45 outposts and chowkis, and we have expanded our manpower,” said deputy inspector general of police Himanshu Shukla of Marine Task Force. Shukla said that Gujarat is the only coastal state in the country to have a force of special Marine Task Commandos.The current infrastructure also took 14 years to come up. The marine police in Gujarat was inaugurated in 2006 and it is jointly funded by the state and central government under the coastal security scheme.In response to a question in the Gujarat assembly last July, MoS Home Pradeepsinh Jadeja had stated that besides the 1,640 km coastline, there are also 144 islands off the coast, of which six have human habitation.The coastal security assumes significance in the light of 26/11 terror attacks of Mumbai in 2008 when 10 LeT members had hijacked a fishing boat ‘Kuber’ off Gujarat coast.

Title: Noida: Site for dumpyard identified, wait now for National Green Tribunal’s nod
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

The proposed landfill site is located in Dostpur Mangrauli village.

NOIDA: While the Noida Authority has finally identified a permanent landfill site in Dostpur Mangrauli village, after 42 years of its inception, the land still needs to be bought from the stakeholders, following the approval of the project by the district administration as well as the National Green Tribunal ( NGT ).

The new site is facing sectors 162 and 164, between the Yamuna checkdam and the DFCC corridor that is under construction. Officials said the project proposal has been sent to the Gautam Budh Nagar magistrate for approval as the site fulfils all criteria under the solid waste management (SWM) rules and is about 500 metres away from any habitation and the Yamuna river. Most of the land is currently agricultural.

“There is no habitation in the vicinity as of now and in future as well there will be no settlement at least 400-500 metres from the landfill site. Even after settlement, this area will mainly have industries and farmhouses. The Yamuna bank is also around 400 metres away. We have kept all parameters in mind for site selection as per the SWM Rules, 2014,” said Avinash Tripathy, OSD, Noida Authority.

Though officials claim that the site is at a considerable distance from the river, it still falls in the riverbed area. “Considering the proximity of the site to the river, we will build another checkdam near the existing one to prevent leachate or seepage towards the Yamuna,” added Tripathy.

“Once the land is bought, it will also need approvals from the irrigation department, the pollution control board and NGT,” another official said.

Title: Wildlife Institute of India takes stock of wildlife around Jewar airport
Content:
The Wildlife Institute of India (WII) conducted a day-long consultation workshop on Saturday to prepare conser... Read More

GREATER NOIDA: The Wildlife Institute of India (WII) conducted a day-long consultation workshop on Saturday to prepare conservation plans for birds and animals that will be affected by the upcoming Jewar international airport.Experts from the wildlife community, residents and environmental activists suggested several conservation steps for sarus and blackbuck habitats.An animal rescue centre has been proposed keeping in view the potential increase in population in the area. Meanwhile, experts said smaller shallow wetlands should be restored so that the sarus cranes can move there along with developing ‘Sarus Mitras’, which helps increase the bird population and also protects their nests.“Uttar Pradesh has an active society for protection of sarus crane and similar steps should be taken here as well. It’s important for the authorities to restore smaller wetlands that are home to sarus and the area being taken away should be adequately compensated. But, these small wetlands should be at least 10 kilometres away,” said Asad Rahmani, member of Governing Body of Wetlands International South Asia and former Director of Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS).Rahmani suggested that locals could be motivated to protect Sarus nests. He said the restored habitats must be protected through minimum intervention. “There should be no garbage dumping around the airport as it attracts the birds,” he said.At the workshop, waste management steps and future noise pollution levels were also discussed. While it was mentioned that blackbucks can be translocated, it disturbs their population. Also, during the construction phase, animals may enter the inhabited area and get killed. “We’ll discuss the proposal with YEIDA,” said PK Srivastava, divisional forest officer.WII officials said all the suggestions will be incorporated in the final proposal for the airport. “While we have submitted our inception report to the government, our study is still going on. We needed to discuss all conservation efforts with the experts and stakeholders so that all suggestions can be incorporated,” said Dhananjay Mohan, director, WII.

Title: Gurugram: Gang snatches 2 prisoners from cops, one held later
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

GURUGRAM: A group of men fired at a van and snatched two murder accused from the clutches of a police team in Faridabad on Saturday. However, one of the two prisoners and two men who had come to free him were arrested following a brief chase and exchange of fire. The other murder accused managed to escape.

Sandeep and Dhan Singh were among five inmates of Bhondsi jail who had been taken to a Faridabad court earlier in the day for a hearing. They were on their way back when their accomplices came in two vehicles and attacked the police van near Hanuman Chowk in Faridabad. An assistant sub-inspector, Jitender, was injured in the cross-firing, but was stated to be out of danger.

Faridabad commissioner of police KK Rao said the police team was caught unawares when the gang came in two vehicles and sprayed bullets on the van carrying the prisoners.

“The men who had come to free the prisoners were stopped at a check-post,” said Rao. They left the vehicles and started running towards a field. After a brief exchange of fire, Dhan Singh, and two of his accomplices — Kapil and Naresh Sethi — were nabbed. Sandeep and a few others managed to flee. At least 10 pistols and 200 live cartridges were found on them.

Sandeep, an accused in at least 12 cases of murder, had been in jail since March 2012. He was serving life term in one of these cases. Police said Sandeep was active in Sonipat, Rohtak, Jhajjar, Hisar and parts of Delhi, and had been lodged in Hisar central jail.

When in jail, Sandeep came in contact with gangster Anil Chitte, who was later killed after being released in 2015. He was also in touch with members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. “Sandeep and his accomplices were operating gangs from inside the jail,” said a police source. It was only last month that Sandeep was shifted to Bhondsi jail. “His gang thrived on extortions from toll operators and businessmen,” the source said.

On December 31, an undertrial from Bhondsi jail had managed to escape after spraying pepper into the eyes of policemen outside Safdarjung Hospital in New Delhi.

Naresh (33) and a few other prisoners from Bhondsi jail had been taken to Safdarjung for a check-up. Sub-inspector Shyam Pool had just stepped out of the police van, when three men came running and fired in the air. Naresh sprayed pepper into the eyes of Shyam and escaped with the help of his accomplices.

Title: Ghaziabad cops to crack down on 28 places for narcotics
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: Police have identified 28 hotspots across the district that are popular points for selling of narcotic items. The places that have been identified are New Bus Stand, Old Bus Stand, Sabzi Mandi in Ghantaghar, railway station, near some schools, parks and other places.

SSP Kalanidhi Naithani told TOI that he has already directed all the concerned police officers of the hotspot areas to arrest the drug peddlers and reach their main supplier. “If any concerned police officer fails to do so, I will take strict action against the officer because they are responsible for any illegal activity in their jurisdiction,” he added.

While domestic drugs like marijuana, hashish and sulfa are smuggled through land routes from Rajasthan, Punjab, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Manipur and Bihar. Drugs such as cocaine, LSD and heroin channel their way into the country through the stomachs of human drug mules from Mexico, Peru and Norway, police said.

Naithani said that there are different syndicates operating in Delhi and that they have constituted special teams to crack down on drug smuggling networks in the city and border areas.

“To keep a check on the supply of narcotics , we have deployed cops in civil uniform to keep an eye on all the party destinations across the city and on all inter-city and inter-state border roads,” he added.

Title: Ghaziabad: Now, an app will help you get your pets registered
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation ( GMC ) on Saturday launched an app that will help people to get their pets registered online.

“After several meetings, the GMC board has formulated bylaws under which the licence fee for owning a dog has fixed at Rs 1,000 a year,” said Dinesh Chandra, the municipal commissioner. “Apart from generating revenue through the registrations, this app will also help us compile data on the number of pets in the city,” the official added.

The ‘Ghaziabad Nagar Nigam Pet Registration’ app, which was launched on Saturday, can be downloaded from Google Playstore. “After downloading the app, pet owners will have to get their names registered along with phone numbers. An OTP would be generated to their numbers, following which they can choose options such as new registration, certificate renewal, status of registration and register dogs,” said Anuj Singh, GMC’s veterinary and social welfare officer.

Before registering, owners will have to fill in details like the name of the pet, its age, breed, sex, rabies vaccination details and the next due date.

“A person will also need to upload a photograph of his pet along with relevant documents and his details. Then, they would be directed to pay the annual registration fee of Rs 1,000 and the online process would be complete,” said Singh.

GMC will take at least two working days to process the registration. A registration certificate would be issued only after all documents are found in order. Pet owners have time till March 31 to get their dogs registered.

However, the new bylaws will also require pet owners to follow a few rules. “Residents owning pets will have to intimate GMC within 15 days. They will also have to ensure that their pets are not left unattended in any public area. They would be fined if their pets are found urinating or defecating in the open,” said Singh.

Title: Govt collects data of 50,000 Gurugram families for identity cards
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

GURUGRAM: The district administration has collected the data of 50,000 families living in Gurugram to make their family ID cards . Under the scheme, the state government aims at creating a database of families in Haryana to deliver all benefits of different citizen-centric services and schemes . Deputy commissioner Amit Khatri held a meeting in which he said a total of 63 camps have been set up so far in the district to spread awareness about the scheme.

“The residents can register themselves for family ID cards in Atal Sewa Kendra to avail benefits of various schemes rolled out by the state government,” said Khatri. The deputy commissioner also said the administration has been organising camps at different places for registrations.

Khatri told the officials in a meeting held on January 29 that the family ID cards will have to be made for timely disbursal of benefits.

The families can register online to get their ID cards. Khatri said, for example, when a person turns 60 years and is registered under the family ID scheme, he or she will get an automated message saying he or she is eligible for the old-age pension.

Moreover, Mukhyamantri Parivar Samridhi Yojna was also discussed in the meeting. Under the scheme, the families with an annual income up to Rs 1.80 lakh and those who own not more than five acres of land will be covered.

These families would be given financial assistance of Rs 6,000 per year for the premium to be paid for different schemes.

Title: Union Budget 2020: New tax deal for the common man
Content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday rolled out a new optional income tax regime that offers lower rates as a trade-off for foregoing exemptions for annual incomes up to Rs 15 lakh. The move was projected as an effort to provide relief and simplicity to taxpayers, particularly those at lower and middle income levels.The tax structure has been rejigged with the introduction of four thinly-sliced tax slabs between Rs 5 lakh and Rs 15 lakh with the rate applicable to each of them going down — from 20% to 10% between Rs 5 lakh and Rs 7.5 lakh, from 20% to 15% in the Rs 7.5 lakh-Rs 10 lakh bracket, from 30% to 20% for Rs 10 lakh-Rs 12.5 lakh and from 30% to 25% between Rs 12.5 lakh and Rs 15 lakh. In return for the lower taxes, those opting for this new scheme would have to forgo all deductions available under the existing regime.The FM in her speech said this would lead to “substantial tax benefit” and gave the example of a person earning Rs 15 lakh and not using any exemptions now. Such a person, she said, could save Rs 78,000 in tax annually.This optional scheme, the FM said, is estimated to cost the exchequer Rs 40,000 crore a year in foregone I-T revenues. What the speech did not spell out, but the budget documents did, is that the option to choose the new scheme would be reversible for those who do not have any business income.The other major change that will impact individual taxpayers is in dividend distribution tax (DDT) currently imposed on companies or funds. Under DDT, companies or mutual funds pay 15% but dividend income up to Rs 10 lakh annually is not added to a person’s taxable income. The Budget has scrapped DDT; dividend income will henceforth form part of an individual’s taxable income. That means it could be taxed at up to 42.7%, the highest rate of tax including surcharges and cesses. The move is seen as a big disincentive for those using investments as tax saving instruments and could explain much of the market’s negative reaction to the Budget.The FM promised that a “taxpayers charter” clearly enumerating their rights would soon be made part of the statutes. The details of the charter were, however, not spelt out in the Budget speech. The purpose of the charter, according to the FM, is to establish trust between the taxpayer and the tax administration.

Title: Gurugram: Vipul Lavanya residents protest upkeep fee hike
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

GURUGRAM: Residents of Vipul Lavanya in Sector 81 have approached the authorities against the developer for abruptly increasing the quarterly maintenance charges of the housing society without their consent.

In a letter to the department of town and country planning (DTCP) on Friday, the residents alleged that the developer had increased the upkeep charges from Rs 2.50 per sq ft to Rs 3.99 per sq ft from this quarter without prior consultation even as they were forced to live in unacceptable conditions.

“When the internal roads of the society are crumbling and plaster from the walls are falling off, we need the builder to repair them and not to increase the upkeep fees. The security guards of the society frequently go on strike because of non-payment of their salaries, which is also a big concern for us,” said Amit Shekhar , RWA president.

“The condition of the society is deteriorating with each passing day. We have complained to the builder several times, but no action has been initiated yet. We received an email on January 10 from the developer about the increase in upkeep fee. This is unacceptable,” he added.

“We have requested the developer to provide us the basis for such a hike. The builder has not yet responded to our several emails. On the other hand, the services of the society are deteriorating day by day,” he said.

Despite repeated attempts, the Vipul Lavanya management could not be contacted.

However, DTCP officials said they would look into the issue. “We will speak to both the parties to arrive at a amicable solution,” said a senior official. The society has around 480 flats and some 400 families are currently living there.

Title: Bihar: 12 lakh to write Intermediate exams from Monday
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Altogether 12.05 lakh candidates, including 5.4 lakh girls, will write the Intermediate (Class XII) examinations to be conducted by Bihar School Examination Board ( BSEB ) at 1,283 examination centres across the state from February 3 to February 13.

BSEB chairman Anand Kishor on Saturday said several steps have been taken to avoid impersonation and use of unfair means by examinees.

Title: Budget 2020 not people-oriented: Jharkhand CM
Content:
This story is from February 2, 2020

Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren being felicitated by localities at CM House in Ranchi on Saturday (AN Photo)

RANCHI: After Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman rolled out Budget 2020 on Saturday, the ruling Mahagathbandhan parties termed it disappointing and said it was contrary to the people's aspirations. Meanwhile, the state BJP unit hailed the budget and called it visionary and development-oriented.

"The budget does not meet the aspirations of the common man. It focusses on the welfare of industrialists and capitalists and increases the troubles of a common man. In her 2.43 hour-long budget speech, the Union finance minister failed to address critical issues like poverty alleviation, inflation and unemployment. There is nothing for the poor, labourers, farmers and the youth of the nation in the budget," chief minister Hemant Soren said.

He added, "We had demanded a tribal university for Jharkhand, but instead, the budget speaks about a tribal museum. This is yet another instance of Adivasis of the state being cheated. The central government has tried to provide relief to those industrialists who indulge in rampant tax evasion, while the middle class has been given only a little relief through income tax." He further said, "This budget, which has neither any vision nor any far-reaching impact, also reveals the Centre's plans to privatise government institutions."

State finance minister and Congress MLA (from Lohardaga) Rameshwar Oraon said, "The budget is unsatisfactory as no comprehensive steps have been taken for job creation, which is the need of the hour. Merely coining new economic terms will not help." He added, "The need of the hour is to address rise of price of essential commodities. Cost of medical appliances too has been increased which will hamper provisions of medical services to the common man. That the people and the industry at large are not happy with the budget was reflected through the sharp post-budget dip in the share market."

Meanwhile, executive president of the Jharkhand Pradesh Congress Committee, Rajesh Thakur, called the budget directionless and said it contains no measures to curb inflation. However, the state BJP functionaries were all praises. Former chief minister Raghubar Das said, "This pro-people budget will help strengthen the economy, increase the purchasing power of the common man and speed up the country's progress."

Ajsu-P president Sudesh Mahto also prasied the budget and said, "This will speed up all-round development of the country."
